reg_info.full_title: O. Reg. 5/97: DELEGATION OF AUTHORITY OF MINISTER: QUINTE-EAST NORTHUMBERLAND MUNICIPAL PLANNING AUTHORITY
reg_info.reg_name_text: DELEGATION OF AUTHORITY OF MINISTER: QUINTE-EAST NORTHUMBERLAND MUNICIPAL PLANNING AUTHORITY
reg_info.act_under: Planning Act   Loi sur l’aménagement du territoire

content.content: 1. (1) The authority of the Minister, (a) under section 51 of the Act, to approve a plan of subdivision; (b) under section 50 of the Condominium Act, to approve or exempt a condominium description; (c) under subsection 88 (3) of the Registry Act and section 146 of the Land Titles Act, to give consent to orders amending plans of subdivision registered after March 27, 1946; and (d) under subsection 305 (2) of the Municipal Act, to approve the laying out of highways less than 20 metres in width, is delegated to the Quinte-East Northumberland municipal planning authority with respect to all applications made after January 5, 1997 for land in the municipalities listed in Schedule 1. O. Reg. 5/97, s. 1 (1). (2) The authority of the Minister under subsection 297 (10) of the Municipal Act, to approve by-laws passed under clause 297 (1) (b) or (c) of the Municipal Act in respect of any highway or part of a highway shown on a registered plan of subdivision registered after March 27, 1946, is delegated to the Quinte-East Northumberland municipal planning authority with respect to all by-laws passed after January 5, 1997 for land in the municipalities listed in Schedule 1. O. Reg. 5/97, s. 1 (2).
content.raw_html:
1. (1) The authority of the Minister,

(a) under section 51 of the Act, to approve a plan of subdivision;

(b) under section 50 of the Condominium Act, to approve or exempt a condominium description;

(c) under subsection 88 (3) of the Registry Act and section 146 of the Land Titles Act, to give consent to orders amending plans of subdivision registered after March 27, 1946; and

(d) under subsection 305 (2) of the Municipal Act, to approve the laying out of highways less than 20 metres in width,

is delegated to the Quinte-East Northumberland municipal planning authority with respect to all applications made after January 5, 1997 for land in the municipalities listed in Schedule 1. O. Reg. 5/97, s. 1 (1).

(2) The authority of the Minister under subsection 297 (10) of the Municipal Act, to approve by-laws passed under clause 297 (1) (b) or (c) of the Municipal Act in respect of any highway or part of a highway shown on a registered plan of subdivision registered after March 27, 1946, is delegated to the Quinte-East Northumberland municipal planning authority with respect to all by-laws passed after January 5, 1997 for land in the municipalities listed in Schedule 1. O. Reg. 5/97, s. 1 (2).

content.content: 2. Despite subsection 1 (1), the authority of the Minister under section 51 of the Act to approve plans of subdivision is delegated to the Quinte-East Northumberland municipal planning authority with respect to applications whose file numbers are set out in Schedule 2. O. Reg. 5/97, s. 2.
content.raw_html: 2. Despite subsection 1 (1), the authority of the Minister under section 51 of the Act to approve plans of subdivision is delegated to the Quinte-East Northumberland municipal planning authority with respect to applications whose file numbers are set out in Schedule 2. O. Reg. 5/97, s. 2.

content.content: 2.1 Despite subsection 1 (1), the approval of the Minister under section 50 of the Condominium Act to approve or exempt a condominium description is delegated to the Quinte East-Northumberland municipal planning authority with respect to an application with the Tile number of 14-CD-92001. O. Reg. 177/97, s. 2
content.raw_html: 2.1 Despite subsection 1 (1), the approval of the Minister under section 50 of the Condominium Act to approve or exempt a condominium description is delegated to the Quinte East-Northumberland municipal planning authority with respect to an application with the Tile number of 14-CD-92001. O. Reg. 177/97, s. 2

content.content: 3. (1) If any authority delegated under section 1 or 2 is in turn delegated to a committee of the municipal planning authority or to an appointed officer under subsection 5 (1) of the Act, the municipal planning authority shall forward to the Minister a certified copy of the delegating by-law within 15 days of its passing. O. Reg. 5/97, s. 3 (1). (2) The delegations of authority in this Regulation are not terminated by reason only that the condition set out in subsection (1) is not complied with. O. Reg. 5/97, s. 3 (2).
content.raw_html:
3. (1) If any authority delegated under section 1 or 2 is in turn delegated to a committee of the municipal planning authority or to an appointed officer under subsection 5 (1) of the Act, the municipal planning authority shall forward to the Minister a certified copy of the delegating by-law within 15 days of its passing. O. Reg. 5/97, s. 3 (1).

(2) The delegations of authority in this Regulation are not terminated by reason only that the condition set out in subsection (1) is not complied with. O. Reg. 5/97, s. 3 (2).

content.content: 4. Omitted (provides for coming into force of provisions of this Regulation). O. Reg. 5/97, s. 4. Schedule 1 1. The Town of Brighton 2. The Township of Brighton 3. The Township of Murray O. Reg. 5/97, Sched. 1.
